metadata.Title: CVE-2023-45863 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in lib/kobject.c in the Linux kernel before 6.2.3.With root access, an attacker can trigger a race condition that results ina fill_kobj_path out-of-bounds write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-45863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-75-generic - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-5.15.0-75-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-75-generic - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-75-generic-64k - 5.15.0-75.82
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-25-generic - 6.2.0-25.25~22.04.2
linux-image-6.2.0-25-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-25.25~22.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-75.82').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
linux-hwe-6.2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-25.25~22.04.2').
